message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV 

This paper proposes a new approach to matching short texts using dependency trees and deep neural networks. The problem of matching short texts is a common task in natural language processing, which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The use of deep neural networks suggests that this paper may also fall under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) or artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of a mining algorithm, which suggests that it may fall under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper tests its algorithm on the problem of matching tweets and responses, which suggests that it may also fall under the category of computer vision (cs.CV) as social media data often includes images and videos.
